question.text: Select the answer which correctly matches the endocrine gland with the hormone it secretes and its function/deficiency symptom.

options.text:
Endocrine gland Hormone Function/deficiency symptoms
Thyroid gland Thyroxine Lack of iodine in diet results in goitre

Endocrine gland Hormone Function/deficiency symptoms
Corpus luteum Testosterone Stimulates spermatogenesis

Endocrine gland Hormone Function/deficiency symptoms
Anterior pituitary Oxytocin Stimulates uterus contraction during childbirth

Endocrine gland Hormone Function/deficiency symptoms
Posterior pituitary Growth Hormone (GH) Oversecretion stimulates abnormal growth

solution.text: The thyroid gland secretes two hormones into the blood, namely thyroxine and tri-iodothyronine  <math><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">T</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mfenced></math> . The corpus luteum secretes progesterone which helps in maintaining pregnancy, the anterior pituitary secretes six major hormones which are prolactin, growth hormone, adrenocorticotropic hormone, luteinizing hormone, follicle-stimulating hormone and thyroid-stimulating hormone each hormone having different roles. The posterior pituitary secretes oxytocin and vasopressin where the former stimulates uterine contractions whereas the latter helps in osmotic regulation.
